definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
satellite TV (abbr. for 衛星電視|卫星电视[wei4 xing1 dian4 shi4])
public cleanliness/(urban) sanitation/environmental sanitation/abbr. for 環境衛生|环境卫生[huan2 jing4 wei4 sheng1]

sentences.english: To defend the Constitution and laws of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 扞卫美国的宪法和法律。

sentences.english: Within days, Wei's article itself had been removed from several state-run websites.
sentences.chinese: 几天后，卫英杰的文章在几个官方网站上自动消失了。

sentences.english: Pay focus on protectplould like resource of rock tea.
sentences.chinese: 着重岩茶种植资源扞卫。

sentences.english: China is just developing technology to defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 中国是扞卫自身的正义建造的技术。

sentences.english: An agent for super star quarterback Brett Farve says his client is retiring.
sentences.chinese: 超级明星四分卫布雷特法弗的经济人称他就要退休了。

sentences.english: The quarterback signed a contract with the Broncos .
sentences.chinese: 这个四分卫和野马队签了合约。

sentences.english: What are the public health implications of global ageing?
sentences.chinese: 全球老龄化的公共卫含意是什生么？

sentences.english: The center's primary role is to pass the football to the quarterback.
sentences.chinese: 中锋的首要任务是把足球传给球队的四分卫。

sentences.english: He quarterbacked for the school team.
sentences.chinese: 他在学校橄榄球队里打四分卫。

sentences.english: While at Purdue, he played quarterback for the Boilermakers football team.
sentences.chinese: 而在普渡，他扮演的锅炉工人足球队的四分卫。

sentences.english: I'm dancin' on Mr. Grave's face.
sentences.chinese: 我踩在古拉卫先生老脸上跳舞。

sentences.english: The wide receiver was wide open when the quarterback threw him the ball.
sentences.chinese: 当四分卫传给外接球员时，他身旁什么人也没有。

sentences.english: Junji the first year of the Qing Dynasty changed its name Wei Jingyuan, Yongzheng was renamed eight years Jingyuan County.
sentences.chinese: 清代顺治元年更名靖远卫，雍正八年改称靖远县。

sentences.english: Police are calling the former NFL quarterback's death a homicide.
sentences.chinese: 警察称这位前美国足联的四分卫的死亡是一起谋杀案。

sentences.english: I will defend my position throughout my political career.
sentences.chinese: 我将扞卫我的立场直到我的政治生涯结束为止。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
high mountain/highest peak of a mountain ridge
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
